c74object.name: ears.in~
c74object.digest: Signal input for a patch loaded by ears.process~
c74object.description: Use the ears.in~ object inside a patch loaded by ears.process~ to create a signal inlet receiving data from an input buffer.

metadatalist.metadata: Andrea Agostini, partly based upon work by Alexander J. Harker

objarg.name: inlet_and_channels
objarg.digest: The llll is composed of two parts:

method.name: llll
method.description:
The llll is composed of two parts:
- an integer, setting the number of the ears.process~ object's inlet from which samples will be passed to ears.in~; and
- a sublist containing the channel numbers of the incoming buffer whose samples will be passed to each outlet of ears.in~.
As a shortcut, if just a flat llll is provided then its first element is interpreted as the inlet number and its subsequent elements are interpreted as the channel indices.
Both parts are optional. If not provided, the inlet number defaults to 1 and only the first channel's samples will be output.
